intro: Erigeron earlei, commonly known as the Sierra daisy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its foliage is usually gray-green with hairy surfaces, and it produces showy white to pale blue flowers. Erigeron earlei is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
